title: Mark Egan interview: Europe's rugby pioneer to Japan on the earthquake that still haunts him more than 20 years on
text:
Mark Egan knows all about the destructive potential of weather in Japan.

Egan, the former Irish and Oxford Universities No 8 and captain, was the first European to play high-grade rugby in Japan, helping Kobe to a record-equalling seventh domestic title in 1995.

The team celebrated in style that January night, and by the time Egan returned to his home, it was already 3.30am. At 5.47am – he recalls the precise time, as he remembers looking at his clock – his apartment started to shake. It continued to do so for 22 seconds, as an earthquake, later measured at 6.9 on the Richter scale, laid waste to the city.
